title: You Realize You Overreacted
summary: After a tense interaction, you realize you were too harsh. Apologize honestly and take responsibility—ownership builds maturity.

scene.setting: After a tense interaction, you realize you were too harsh. You may feel regret or defensive; the hidden risk is ignoring it and integrity suffering. The decision point is protect ego vs apologize honestly.

beats.narration: You've realized you overreacted. The decision point is ignore or offer a sincere apology.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: I was wrong to respond that way. I'm sorry. Is there anything else you need me to address?

choices.label: Ignore it and hope they forget.

steps.step: Offer sincere apology: 'I was wrong to respond that way'; no buts or excuses; ask if there's anything else to address.

leader_lines: Ignoring rarely repairs trust. I need to apologize.
What's the cost of not apologizing?
questions: What would repair the working relationship?
What do I need to own?
scripts.closing_line: I was wrong; no buts; ask what else to address.

choices.label: Offer a sincere apology and take responsibility.

steps.step: Sincere apology: 'I was wrong to respond that way'; no buts or excuses.
Ask if there's anything else to address; what you'll do differently.

leader_lines: I was wrong to respond that way. I'm sorry.
How do we apologize without over-explaining?
questions: Is there anything else to address?
What would help repair the working relationship?
scripts.closing_line: I was wrong; no buts; ask what else; what I'll do differently.

choices.label: Blame stress and say you didn't mean it.

steps.step: One clear acknowledgment; what you'll do differently; then move forward—stress is context, not excuse.

leader_lines: Blame shifts responsibility. I was wrong to respond that way—stress is context, not excuse.
How do we own it without over-apologizing?
scripts.closing_line: One clear acknowledgment; what I'll do differently; move forward.

choices.label: Apologize and ask what would help repair the working relationship.

steps.step: Apologize; ask what would help repair; pause before responding next time; notice triggers; debrief with a peer.

leader_lines: I'm sorry. What would help repair our working relationship?
Asking shows you care about repair.
questions: How do we prevent overreacting next time?
scripts.closing_line: Pause before responding; notice triggers; debrief with peer.

system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you protect ego or apologize honestly?

outcomes.message: They may not forget. Trust is damaged; you chose ego over repair.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with sincere apology?
What's the cost of not apologizing?

outcomes.message: They felt respected. Relationship can repair; you modeled accountability.
reflection_questions: How do you apologize without over-explaining?
How do you prevent overreacting next time?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I took ownership when I overreacted. (1-5)
